{{Day}}

==Events==
*  [[54]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Claudius]] is poisoned to death under mysterious circumstances. His 17-year-old stepson [[Nero]] succeeds him to the Roman throne.
* [[409]] &ndash; [[Vandals]] and [[Alans]] cross the [[Pyrenees]] and appear in [[Hispania]].
*[[1307]] &ndash; Hundreds of [[Knights Templar]] in [[France]] are simultaneously arrested by agents of [[Philip IV of France|Phillip the Fair]], to be later tortured into a "[[Coercion|confession]]" of [[Christian heresy|heresy]].
*[[1332]] &ndash; [[Rinchinbal Khan, Emperor Ningzong of Yuan]] becomes the [[Khagan]] of the [[Mongols]] and Emperor of the [[Yuan Dynasty]], reigning for only 53 days.
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar]], this day does not exist in this year in [[Italy]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]] and [[Spain]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; A Swedish–Dutch fleet defeats the Danish fleet at [[Battle of Fehmarn (1644)|Fehmarn]] and captures about 1,000 prisoners.
*[[1710]] &ndash; [[Habitation at Port-Royal|Port Royal]], the capital of French [[Acadia]], [[Siege of Port Royal (1710)|falls in a siege]] by British forces.
*[[1773]] &ndash; The [[Whirlpool Galaxy]] is discovered by [[Charles Messier]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; The [[United States Continental Congress]] orders the establishment of the [[Continental Navy]] (later renamed the [[United States Navy]]).
*[[1792]] &ndash; In [[Washington, D.C.]], the cornerstone of the [[United States]] Executive Mansion (known as the [[White House]] since 1818) is laid.
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: [[Battle of Queenston Heights]] &ndash; As part of the [[Niagara campaign]] in [[Ontario, Canada]], [[United States]] forces under General [[Stephen Van Rensselaer III|Stephen Van Rensselaer]] are repulsed from invading [[Canada]] by [[United Kingdom|British]] and native troops led by Sir [[Isaac Brock]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; In [[New York City]], [[Henry Jones (B'nai Brith)|Henry Jones]] and 11 others found [[B'nai B'rith]] (the oldest [[Jew]]ish service organization in the world).
*[[1845]] &ndash; A majority of voters in the [[Republic of Texas]] approve a proposed constitution that, if accepted by the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]], will make [[Texas]] a [[U.S. state]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; [[Revival of the Hebrew language#First Aliyah|First known conversation]] in modern Hebrew by [[Eliezer Ben-Yehuda]] and friends.
*[[1884]] &ndash; [[Greenwich]], in [[London]], [[England]], is established as [[Universal Time]] meridian of longitude.
*[[1885]] &ndash; The [[Georgia Institute of Technology]] (Georgia Tech) is founded in Atlanta, United States.
*[[1892]] &ndash; [[Edward Emerson Barnard]] discovers [[206P/Barnard-Boattini|D/1892 T1]], the first [[comet]] discovered by photographic means, on the night of October 13–14.
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[Prince Arthur, Duke of Connaught and Strathearn]], becomes the first [[Governor-General of Canada]] of royal descent.
*[[1914]] &ndash; In [[Major League Baseball]]'s [[1914 World Series|World Series]], the [[1914 Boston Braves season|Boston Braves]] defeat the [[1914 Philadelphia Athletics season|Philadelphia Athletics]], 4 games to 0, at [[Fenway Park]] in [[Boston]], completing the first World Series [[Sweep#Sports|sweep]] in history.
*[[1915]] &ndash; The Battle for the [[Hohenzollern Redoubt]] marks the end of the [[Battle of Loos]] in northern France, World War I.
*[[1917]] &ndash; The [[Solar Miracle of Fatima|"Miracle of the Sun"]] is witnessed by an estimated 70,000 people in the Cova da Iria in [[Fátima, Portugal]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Mehmed Talat Pasha]] and the [[Young Turk]] (C.U.P.) ministry resign and sign an armistice, ending [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] participation in [[World War I]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; The Soviet republics of [[Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|Russia]], [[Armenian Soviet Socialist Republic|Armenia]], [[Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic|Azerbaijan]], and [[Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic|Georgia]] sign the [[Treaty of Kars]] with the [[Grand National Assembly of Turkey]] to establish the contemporary borders between Turkey and the South Caucasus states.
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Ankara]] replaces [[Istanbul]] as the capital of [[Turkey]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The new government of [[Italy]] sides with the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] and declares war on [[Germany]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: [[Riga]], the capital of [[Latvia]] is occupied by the [[Red Army]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[France]] [[French constitutional referendum, October 1946|adopts]] the constitution of the [[French Fourth Republic|Fourth Republic]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Paddington Bear]], a classic character from English [[children's literature]], makes his debut.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Pacific Northwest]] experiences [[Columbus Day Storm of 1962|a cyclone]] the equal of a Cat 3 hurricane. Winds measured above 150&nbsp;mph at several locations; 46 people died.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The first game in the history of the [[American Basketball Association (1967-1976)|American Basketball Association]] is played as the [[Anaheim Amigos]] lose to the [[Virginia Squires|Oakland Oaks]] 134-129 in [[Oakland, California]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Fiji]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; An [[Aeroflot]] [[Ilyushin Il-62]] [[Aeroflot Flight 217|crashes]] outside [[Moscow]] killing 174.
*  1972 &ndash; [[Uruguayan Air Force Flight 571]] crashes in the [[Andes]] mountains, near the border between [[Argentina]] and [[Chile]]. By [[December 23]], 1972, only 16 out of 45 people lived long enough to be rescued.
*[[1976]] &ndash; A Bolivian [[Boeing 707]] cargo jet crashes in [[Santa Cruz, Bolivia]], killing 100 (97, mostly children, killed on the ground).
*  1976 &ndash; The first [[Electron microscope|electron micrograph]] of an [[Ebola]] [[virus|viral]] particle is obtained by [[Dr. F.A. Murphy]], now at [[University of California, Davis|U.C. Davis]], who was then working at the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention|C.D.C.]]
*[[1977]] &ndash; Four [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]]s hijack ''[[Lufthansa Flight 181]]'' to [[Somalia]] and demand release of 11 members of the [[Red Army Faction]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Ameritech Mobile Communications]] (now [[AT&T Inc.]]) launched the first US [[cellular network]] in [[Chicago, Illinois]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; End of the [[Lebanese Civil War]]. [[Syria]]n forces launch an attack on the free areas of [[Lebanon]] removing [[General Michel Aoun]] from the presidential palace.
*[[1992]] &ndash; An [[Antonov An-124]] operated by [[Antonov Airlines]] registered CCCP-82002, crashes near [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]] killing 8.
*[[2010]] &ndash; The [[2010 Copiapó mining accident]] in [[Copiapó]], [[Chile]] comes to an end as all 33 miners arrive at the surface after surviving a record 69 days underground awaiting rescue.
